pageContext.claim: “Even when I was doing the Wollman Rink, the city couldn't build it. Took them nine years. They had no idea what they were doing. And I had that whole big -- about 70,000 feet -- it's like a massive office floor -- bigger than an office floor.”
pageContext.analysis: When Trump took over the job -- one of his most famous achievements as a builder -- the city had been trying to do it for six years, not nine years. The rink is a little over 30,000 square feet, not 70,000 feet, according to the Wollman website.
